text: Church Stretton railway station is a railway station serving the market town of Church Stretton in Shropshire, England. It is located on the Welsh Marches line, 12 3‚ÅÑ4 miles (20.5 km) south of Shrewsbury railway station; though trains on the Heart of Wales line also stop at the station. All trains services are operated by Transport for Wales, who also manage the station. The station opened on 20 April 1852 as part of the newly created Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway. It is the highest station in Shropshire, 613 ft (187 m) above sea level. Category:Railway stations in England Category:Buildings and structures in Shropshire
title: Church Stretton railway station
